name: mediator
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person whose job is to mediate in a disagreement (= talk to the people or groups involved to help them find a solution): The governor appointed a mediator and asked both sides to return to the bargaining table. Trained mediators are extremely effective and have reduced bullying dramatically. See
mediate
More examplesFewer examplesWe do not consider him a neutral mediator at all.He could succeed where European mediators have failed because the guerrillas respect him.We will train people in firms who want to become mediators, or send in mediators to help.

a person who tries to end a disagreement by helping the two sides to talk about and agree on a solution: Lawyers acting for the companies held another meeting with mediators this week.a federal/independent/UN mediator After talks reached an impasse last month, US federal mediators instituted a 30-day cooling-off period.act/serve as mediator She has agreed to act as mediator and meet with the board to try to resolve the dispute.
